conclusion: Trace the path of the liquid from each starting point (A, B, C, and D) through the baffles to the containers.
The liquid from A will encounter the black baffle first, which is slanted downwards to the right.
The liquid will follow the slope of the black baffle and move towards the right.
Next, it will encounter the brown baffle, which is slanted downwards to the left.
The liquid will follow the slope of the brown baffle and move towards the left.
Finally, it will reach container E.
The liquid from B will encounter the brown baffle first, which is slanted downwards to the left.
The liquid will follow the slope of the brown baffle and move towards the left.
Next, it will encounter the white baffle, which is slanted downwards to the right.
The liquid will follow the slope of the white baffle and move towards the right.
Finally, it will reach container E.
The liquid from C will encounter the pink baffle first, which is slanted downwards to the right.
The liquid will follow the slope of the pink baffle and move towards the right.
Next, it will encounter the purple baffle, which is slanted downwards to the left.
The liquid will follow the slope of the purple baffle and move towards the left.
Finally, it will reach container F.
The liquid from D will encounter the blue baffle first, which is slanted downwards to the left.
The liquid will follow the slope of the blue baffle and move towards the left.
Next, it will encounter the orange baffle, which is slanted downwards to the right.
The liquid will follow the slope of the orange baffle and move towards the right.
Finally, it will reach container G.
Liquid from A will flow into container E.
Liquid from B will flow into container E.
